natural solution: We can write $f(x)$ as follows: \[f(x) = \left\{ \begin{array}{cl} x^2 & \text{if $x > 0$}, \\ 0 & \text{if $x = 0$}, \\ -x^2 & \text{if $x < 0$}. \end{array} \right.\]Hence, $f^{-1}(4) + f^{-1}(-100) = 2 + (-10) = \boxed{-8}.$

a_5.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" and inv_f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "bij f"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. f x = x * abs x"
and h2 : "\<forall> y. inv_f y = (if y \<ge> 0 then sqrt y else - sqrt (-y))"
shows  "inv_f 4 + inv_f (-100) = -8"
a_5.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Let $f(x) = x|x|.$  Find $f^{-1}(4) + f^{-1}(-100).$ The final Answer is -8
 ### Proof
 We can write $f(x)$ as follows: \[f(x) = \left\{ \begin{array}{cl} x^2 & \text{if $x > 0$}, \\ 0 & \text{if $x = 0$}, \\ -x^2 & \text{if $x < 0$}. \end{array} \right.\]Hence, $f^{-1}(4) + f^{-1}(-100) = 2 + (-10) = \boxed{-8}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" and inv_f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "bij f"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. f x = x * abs x"
and h2 : "\<forall> y. inv_f y = (if y \<ge> 0 then sqrt y else - sqrt (-y))"
shows  "inv_f 4 + inv_f (-100) = -8"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_5.informal problem: Given a function $f(x) = x * |x|$ and its inverse $f^{-1}(y) = \sqrt{y}$ for $y \geq 0$ and $f^{-1}(y) = -\sqrt{-y}$ for $y < 0$, find the value of $f^{-1}(4) + f^{-1}(-100)$. The final answer is $-8$.
